SEARCH

Class AVLTree<K extends Comparable<? super K>,V>

java.lang.Object
BinaryTree<Entry<K,V>>
AVLTree<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - The type of the key - should be Comparable
V - The type of the value.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Entry<K,V>>
public class AVLTree<K extends Comparable<? super K>,V> extends BinaryTree<Entry<K,V>>
A representation of an AVL tree. This tree extends a BinaryTree and makes of AVLNodes to store entries. This code works differently than the code provided in the textbook, however the algorithms are the same. In all cases you can use the textbook to help you get the the correct solution. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !! DO NOT COPY THE CODE DIRECTLY FROM THE TEXTBOOK AS THIS WILL RESULT IN A !! !! SOLUTION THAT DOES NOT WORK AND WILL BE A WASTE OF YOUR TIME. !! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

    • insert

      public BTPosition<Entry<K,V>> insert(K key, V value)
      Inserts an item into the AVL tree. This will insert a new Key and Value or will update an existing key or value for simplicity.
      Parameters:
      key - the key to add
      value - the value to add
      Returns:
      The Position where the new node has been inserted

    • remove

      public Entry<K,V> remove(K key)
      Removes an item from the AVL tree
      Parameters:
      key - the key that should be removed
      Returns:
      the removed item or null if there was nothing to remove.

    • treeSearch

      public BTPosition<Entry<K,V>> treeSearch(K key, BTPosition<Entry<K,V>> node)
      Search for an item in the tree. This function is recursive. If the key that you are currently looking for is less then the key in the current node then call this function on the left child of the node. The the key is greater than the key in this node then call this function on the right child of the node. If the key is equal then call return the node.
      Parameters:
      key - The key we are looking for
      node - the current node we are considering
      Returns:
      A node. This will either be the node, or the position where the node should exist in the tree. //****************** 5 marks ********************************

    • addLevelTabs

      public String addLevelTabs(int level)
      Return a string that returns a number of tabs that are specified by the parameter level.
      Parameters:
      level - the number of tabs to include in a returned string
      Returns:
      a string that contains the number of tabs equal to level

    • doTraversal

      public String doTraversal(String currentString, BTPosition<Entry<K,V>> root, int level)
      Perform a preorder traversal of the passed tree
